docs.lead_paragraph: As scores of communities in northern New Jersey rejected school budgets last week, residents of this sprawling suburb of 93,000 people voted their approval of a budget for the first time in 27 years. The deeply divided school board had virtually insured the passage of the $103 million budget by first cutting $4.5 million from it, which guaranteed that no new taxes would be needed.

headline.main: Woodbridge Schools Pay for Voter Support
